modules.description: This module constructs and validates precise datetime specifications with optional timezone and offset constraints. It supports building datetime values with fields like year, month, day, hour, and nanoseconds, resolving ambiguities using a lean direction. Concrete use cases include parsing and normalizing partial datetime inputs, such as scheduling rules or recurring events with specific time constraints.

This module provides functions to flatten sequences or lists of time-related ranges into simplified sequences or lists of individual values. It operates on ranges of integers representing months, ISO weeks, month days, and weekdays, producing contiguous or merged values where overlapping ranges are resolved. These functions are useful for expanding scheduling constraints into discrete time units for further processing or display.

This module enables constructing and manipulating time intervals and datetime patterns through operations like intersection, union, shifting, and logical composition. It works with time intervals (`t`) and datetime components (years, months, days) to model constraints for scheduling, filtering sequences of timestamps, or resolving recurring time boundaries. Specific use cases include defining periodic schedules, transforming timestamp sequences with temporal logic, and resolving complex date-time constraints into concrete intervals.
